intro: Pellionia tritepala, commonly known as the velvetleaf pellionia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white and clustered in dense inflorescences. Pellionia tritepala is valued in horticulture for its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in humid, low-light conditions.
